description.narrative:
the project "Collective Voice and Action for Migrants Workers rights" will be implemented by M.net - a network of local NGOs for the Rights of Migrant workers at national level.
The project aims that "Migrant workers and informal workers, especially female workers in rural and sub-urban areas, are empowered to claim their better access to social protection and employment". Its specific objective is "The Network of Action for Migrant Workers - M.net is strengthened to represent and influence other stakeholders, especiallypolicy makers, to improve policies for migrant workers# rights". To achieve this, the project will focus on 3 main strategies, include: 1. build capacity for migrant workers# leaders to analyse their issues, and organize, inspires migrant workers to join the migrant worker network to decide on the design, implementation and evaluation of their own working agenda . The project will connect the existing sets of migrant group/club that are supporting by M.net members and other organizations under a Core Migrant Group. Core workers group (CWG) including representatives from migrant workers groups supported by Mnet members and other existing groups in different provinces (Bac Ninh, Dong Nai, HCMC, Hai Duong, Vinh Phuc, Ha Noi...). They are taking or formal employment in the industrialzones or informal employments (as domestic work, garbage collection, street vending, services#). These members of the group will play a role as a connected line between the Group and their set of groups and, in cooperation with M.net, create collective and uniquevoice/actions at national level. The group will be formed through sharing workshop/forum and be strengthened with jointly activities. 2. Strengthen M.net and make it well organized to be able to develop policy recommendation/proposal with support from its constituencies and allies Improved access to social protection for migrant workers needs an improvement in policies. This will only come with sustained representation. Policy and policy change happen when pressure, information and campaigning are linked through all levels - workers linked to their organizations that in turn link into networks and alliances. The Network of Action for Migrant Workers, M.net, has been established by Vietnamese nongovernmental organizations working on rights of migrant workers since October 2014. Theprimary purpose of the network is to enhance the evidence-based policy advocacy by engaging with and creating equal opportunities for migrant workers, especially informal migrant workers, in social protection framework in Vietnam. Currently M.net has 6 members, one coordinator and LIGHT as coordinating organization. But there is no clear structure on Management Board, Advisory Board and otherfunctions. All of the members have specific expertise, including community intervention, legal advice, research and working for their owned targeted group# However their knowledge on other kind of migrants group is still weak. Their jointly actions are limited. The project will use M.net as a starting point for a united and strong network for the right of migrant workers and make effective influence at national level. At the same time with support Core Migrant Group, the project will build capacity for M.net, support M.net to be well organized and improve their jointly actions with support from its constituencies and allies. 3. Support M.net and migrant workers leaders increased advocacy capacity and practise their collective voice and action to enhance migrants# access to social protection with improved support from governments If the 2 above strategies try to influence separately Core Migrant Group and M.net # representative organizations of migrant worker, the 3nd one will focus on strengthen the link between Core MigrantGroup and M.net through support M.net and migrant workers leaders to increased advocacy capacity and practise their collective voice and action to enhance migrants# access to social protection with improved support from governments. The project will support M.net and migrant workers leaders conduct research, pilot model and policy and practise change advocacy activities.
The project in combination with other 4 projects developed and carried out by M.net#s members will create a comprehensive strategy which makes influence at all levels(migrant workers, migrant group and migrants# leader network/group). The other 4 projects carried out by M.net#s members will target at specific kind of migrant workers. They will build capacity for migrant workers on relevant skills and knowledge to fulfil theirrights in accessing social protection services and establish and develop migrants# representation under the organic form of self-help groups. At higher level, the project will target at migrants# leaders, built their capacity and support them to actively joint into M.net and make influence and engage other stakeholders such as governmental agencies, social organizations, institutions and communities for improvement in policy to equal access to social protection of migrant workers. The advocacy activities run by the project are also supported from other 4 projects developed and carried out by M.net#s members. All advocacy campaigns will be proposal by other project carried out by M.net#s members and a jointly action plan will be developed with support and participation of all its members. These action plans will be designed in reviewing other 4 projects developed and carried out by M.net#s members to ensure that all are linked and support together.
Specifically, the project expected results/ outputs and interventions include:
Result1. Migrant workers# leadersfrom at least 5 provinces of Vietnam are able to analyse their issues, and organize, inspires migrant workers to join the migrant worker networkto decide on the design, implementation and evaluation of their own working agenda
outputs of theresult 1: Output1.1.A Core Migrant Group established to serve as a platform for workers to exchange, learn new knowledge and exercise their leadership Output 1.2. Migrant workers have broader knowledge on their issues and improved community organizing and leadership abilities Output 1.3. at least 5 initiatives to promote gender equity and social protection designed and implemented by the Coremigrant network
interventions of the result 1: # Established and developed a group of migrant leaders/workersCapacity building andImproved knowledge on leadership, HR-value, social protection and evidence-based policy advocacy of migrant leaders # Support migrants#leader initiatives such as dialogue between migrant groups and relevant stakeholders, advocacy campaigns, communication campaigns .... and support them to raise their voice in national and regional workshops, forums, dialogues # Pilot model of public health monitoring and SEDP with participation of migrants, and develop feedback mechanism on public services
Result2. M.net is able to develop policy recommendation/proposal with support from its constituencies and allies.
outputs of the result 2: Output 2.1. M.net has atransparency and effective internal governance (decision making process, roles and responsibility of M.net members) Output 2.2. Increased number of M.net member and CSOs engaging in M.net#s advocacy activities Output2.3. at least 4policy recommendations/ proposals to promote better social protection and working condition for women worker have identified and agreed by Mnet for joint advocacy interventions of the result 2: # Develop strategies by Mnet to collaborate with other like minded groups/organizations. # Capacitybuilding for Mnet, especially on social protectionknowledge, migration issues, advocacy skills, alliance building# # Support M.net participate in national/regional workshop/forum on policy advocacy, labor rights, social protection and migration, decent work#
Result3. M.net and migrant workers leaders have increased advocacy capacity to practise their collective voice and action to enhance migrants# access to social protection with improved support from governments
outputs of the result 3: Output 3.1. Mnet has evidence for their policy and practise change recommendations/ proposals. Output 3.2. M.net and its members actively participate in at least 2advocacy activities at regional level and 4 activities at national levels with other like-minded organizations and alliances.; output3.3: at least 2 recommendations/ proposals to promote better social protection and working condition for migrant workers and women worker are acknowledged by policy makers
interventions of the result 3: # Support M.net and migrant leadersconduct research, collect evidence on relevant issues of migrant workers # Improved M.net and migrant leader joinlty policy advocacy campaign # Pride events of migrant leaders groups andM.net (Jointly action)

participating-org.narrative: Institute for Development and Commu Health

LIGHT is a local NGO established in 29 Sep 2003, based in Ha Noi with an average annual budget of 185,000 Euro, working with several target groups including informal migrant workers. LIGHT also partnership with Asia Foundation, Ministry of Health, Plan International, UNWomen, etc. LIGHT started partnership with Oxfam since 2014. LIGHT mission: LIGHT serve disadvantaged groups through our programs, which aim to improve their quality of life, sexual and reproductive health and social wellbeing. Based on their needs and concerns, we act as a bridge between them and available social and community resources to ensure these resources are used transparently and effectively

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
